intro: Clibadium badieri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, orange-yellow fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest in botanical research and traditional medicine.
